content.full_text:
A Bill Supplemental to "An Act to Erect Certain Bridges," Approved January 22, 1831,

1 No348A. bill for an act supplemental to an act entitled "An act to erect certain bridges"

approved Jan. 22— 1831 An act supplemental to an act entitled "an act to erect certain bridges" approved

Jan, 22. 1831 Be it enacted by the People of the State of Illinois represented in theGeneral Assembly: That the county ofKnox2shall be entitled to all the benefits of the act to which this is supplemental; Provided

thecounty commissioner's courtof said county, shall comply with the requisites of said act, within two years from

the passage of this act.3
paragraphs: A Bill Supplemental to "An Act to Erect Certain Bridges," Approved January 22, 1831,
1 No348A. bill for an act supplemental to an act entitled "An act to erect certain bridges"
approved Jan. 22— 1831 An act supplemental to an act entitled "an act to erect certain bridges" approved

Jan, 22. 1831 Be it enacted by the People of the State of Illinois represented in theGeneral Assembly: That the county ofKnox2shall be entitled to all the benefits of the act to which this is supplemental; Provided
thecounty commissioner's courtof said county, shall comply with the requisites of said act, within two years from
citations: Illinois HouseJournal. 1836. 10th G. A., 1st sess., 580, 651, 804, 808, 837, 846; Illinois SenateJournal. 1836. 10th G. A., 1st sess., 471, 533, 559, 582, 595, 626.
“An Act to Erect Certain Bridges,” 22 January 1831,Laws of Illinois(1831), 37-38.

footnotes.text:
1Abraham Lincoln wrote the text of this bill as well as its title on the back page.On February 13, 1837,William McMurtryfrom the Committee on the Militia introduced in the House of Representatives HB 281,
                  which was written by Abraham Lincoln.  On February 20, the House passed the bill without
                  amendment, and referred it to theSenate. On March 2, following the addition of amendments by a select committee, the Senate
                  passed theamended bill. That same day, the House concurred in the Senate amendments. TheCouncil of Revisionthen approved the bill, and theactbecame law.Illinois HouseJournal. 1836. 10th G. A., 1st sess., 580, 651, 804, 808, 837, 846; Illinois SenateJournal. 1836. 10th G. A., 1st sess., 471, 533, 559, 582, 595, 626.
2The finalbillas passed included McDonough County as well.

3The 1831 Act appropriated $200 to Knox County for a bridge across Spoon River and
                  $150 to McDonough County for a bridge across Crooked Creek. The Act stipulated that
                  the county commissioners courts were to choose the bridge sites and control construction.
                  Upon completion of the bridges, each county’s commissioners court was required to
                  certify as such to the Auditor of Public Accounts, who at that point would release
                  to them the  the amounts appropriated to their counties.“An Act to Erect Certain Bridges,” 22 January 1831,Laws of Illinois(1831), 37-38.

A Bill Supplemental to "An Act to Erect Certain Bridges," Approved January 22, 1831,
               [13 February 1837]1

No348A. bill for an act supplemental to an act entitled "An act to erect certain bridges"
               approved Jan. 22— 1831

An act supplemental to an act entitled "an act to erect certain bridges" approved
               Jan, 22. 1831

Be it enacted by  the  People of the State of Illinois represented in theGeneral Assembly: That the county ofKnox2shall be entitled to all the benefits of the act to which this is supplemental; Provided
               thecounty commissioner's courtof said county, shall comply with the requisites of said act, within two years from
               the passage of this act.3
